A young man presenting with features of recurrent brief depressive disorder, each lasting for about 3 to 7 days, for over a year. He had history of occasional headache and episodes of swooning attack in between, usually precipitated by emotional events. His neuroimaging revealed agenesis of corpus callosum. He was experiencing swooning attacks as he became aware that some ‘unusual’ findings were present in his reports. Recurrent brief depression can be a manifestation of this congenital anomaly, and conversion disorder can be present as comorbid diagnosis perhaps due to ignorance and fear of this apparently innocuous congenital malformation. What is blood supply of corpus callosum.

options.label: A
options.text: Anterior cerebral artery and middle cerebral artery

options.label: B
options.text: Anterior cerebral artery and posterior cerebral artery

options.label: C
options.text: Anterior cerebral artery and anterior communicating artery

options.label: D
options.text: Middle cerebral artery and posterior cerebral artery

questions.correct_answer: C. Anterior cerebral artery and anterior communicating artery
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Anterior cerebral artery and anterior communicating artery

questions.text: A patient presented 2 years back with abdominal pain in epigastrium. On examination pallor, koilonychia, glossitis and angular stomatitis were found. On blood examination his RBC count and Hb count were decreased and microcytic hypochromic RBCs were found. On history taking he also informed about chronic hematemesis. Upper GI endoscopy was performed. on biopsy sample gram negative , ‘S’ shaped lophotrichous bacteria was found in pyloric region. For bacterial confirmation microbiology tests were done where urease positive +ve bacteria were confirmed. Even after appropriate medical management of Omeprazole, Clarithromycin and Amoxicillin, hematemesis and other symptoms not relieved and bleeding increased. Finally Surgical team decided to ligate the following artery to check bleeding

A patient visited to medicine OPD with ataxia, hearing impairment, Hornor’s syndrome, loss of pain and temperature from right side of face and also from left side of body. In cerebral angiography narrowing of marked artery is visible. What is your diagnosis and which artery is involved?

options.label: A
options.text: Medial medullary syndrome, Posterior cerebral artery

options.label: C
options.text: Medial medullary syndrome ; Posterior inferior cerebellar artery

options.label: D
options.text: Lateral medullary syndrome ; Posterior inferior cerebellar artery

questions.correct_answer: B. Lateral medullary syndrome ; Vertebral artery
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Lateral medullary syndrome ; Vertebral artery

options.label: A
options.text: The relationship between muscle innervation and joint function.

questions.correct_answer: C. The connection between the nerve supplying a joint and the muscles moving the joint.

questions.text: Concept of “Anatomical position” is very essential for all kind of operative procedure and to understand and publish the articles. About anatomical position, which of the following statements is true?

options.label: A
options.text: The palms of the hands are facing posteriorly.

options.label: C
options.text: The feet are dorsiflexed at the ankles.

questions.correct_answer: B. The thumbs are oriented laterally.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The thumbs are oriented laterally.

questions.text: A 28-year-old male presents with anterior knee pain that worsens with activities like running and jumping. options.text: Between the diaphysis and the epiphysis

questions.correct_answer: B. Between the diaphysis and the epiphysis
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Between the diaphysis and the epiphysis

questions.text: A 21 years old patient Suyash came to OPD with history of fall on hand. Now he is having pain at hand region. X ray of patient is given. Which of the following joint has been shown in his X ray ?

questions.explanation: Ans. A) Atlanto-axial joint and atlanto-occipital joint.
